title: The Hollywood Palace 12-12-67
description:
Here is a nice bootleg. Check my account for more classic bootlegs.

Please enjoy, share with friends and please seed :)

"The Hollywood Palace"
December 12, 1967 (original airdate) - U.S. TV - abc Network

Venue: El Capitan Theater (owned by ABC at the time and renamed the "ABC Hollywood Palace")
Hollywood, California, U.S.A.

The A&M Records 1967 TV Special featuring:

--host: Herb Alpert
--Herb Alpert & the Tijuana Brass--Wes Montgomery
--Burt Bacharach
--Liza Minnelli
--Sergio Mendes & Brasil '66
--The Baja Marimba Band
--Boyce & Hart

In COLOR with nearly perfect picture & very decent TV sound quality. Grade A!

Also features all of the original 1967 TV commercials!
This was previously posted as a flawed unplayable DVD. Various rework methods were posted in the earlier seed comments but most of the programs used to do this probably involved re-encoding of the data. This version here did not involve any re-encoding of the media and better title and chapter menus were added. Since the original audio was LPCM, it could be extensively fine-tuned with Pro Tools - normalization of the very low levels by almost 15 dB, other level change repairs with silencing of blank spots, lots of clicks manually removed, plus some low end EQ boost to make the TV sound a bit less tinny-sounding. No digital noise reduction was used in the audio remastering process.

Here's the rest of the new lineage/remastering info:The audio and video media was extracted losslessly by Cinematize 2 as elementary stream files. The video media is the same 2 files, though they were cropped tighter with DVD Studio Pro when authoring to clip the blank beginning and some of the l-o-o-o-n-n-g abc station ID that was at the end (cut to about 5 seconds from the original 30 seconds).

Show transcript details:--Opening credits 
--Commercials: (1) Pruf spray starch; (2) Ultra-Brite toothpaste ad with couple flirting on airplane. (jingle: "Ultra-Brite gives your mouth...sex appeal"). --Herb Alpert & the Tijuana Brass - "With A Little Help from My Friends" (instrumental) 
--Herb Alpert (host) talks about his band, the Tijuana Brass, and their record company, A&M records. (All guests on this show recorded with A&M Records. The A in A&M Records was Herb Albert himself).
--Liza Minnelli - "Happy Time" and "Mammy" 
--Herb Alpert congratulates Liza on her recent marriage to Peter Allen. 
Commercial: Pepto-Bismol tablets 
--Herb Albert introduces the Baja Marimba Band, who perform an instrumental song. 
--Baja Marimba Band - 2nd song: "Fiddler on the Roof" theme (instrumental)
--Wes Montgomery (jazz guitarist) - "Windy" (instrumental) 
Commercial: Gulf gasoline service stations (promising fast service) 
--Herb asks Sergio Mendes how he got his start. 
--Sergio Mendes & Brasil '66 (with female singers) - "Going Out of My Head" 
ABC station ID break 
Commercial: Pall-Mall cigarettes ("extra-long at both ends") 
--Herb introduces Burt Bacharach. 
--Burt Bacharach sings "What the World Needs Now," "What's New, Pussycat?" and "Alfie" 
--Medley of Bacharach songs: 
(1) Brasil '66 - "The Look of Love" 
(2) Wes Montgomery - "Wives and Lovers" (instrumental)
(3) Liza Minnelli - "I Say A Little Prayer for You" 
(4) Baja Marimba Band - "Walk on By" (instrumental)
(5) Liza Minnelli and Wes Montgomery - "Trains And Boats And Planes"
(6) Herb Alpert - "Casino Royale" (with Bacharach playing piano)
 Commercials: Fleischmann's Margarine; Royal Shake-A-Puddin' dessert mix.
 --Boyce & Hart - medley ("I Wanna Be Free" & "Last Train To Clarksville") and "I Wonder What She's Doing Tonight"
 Commercial: Hamilton-Beach electric carving knives and Cook-Book blender 
 --Herb Alpert & The Tijuana Brass - instrumental song 
--Herb notices a man sleeping in audience. He wonders what the man is dreaming about. This is followed by a dream sequence with Herb Alpert's instrumental songs:
 (1) "The Lonely Bull" (man dreams of being a bullfighter);
 2) "Tijuana Taxi"
 (3) "Never on Sunday"
 (4) "Zorba the Greek" 
 --Herb Alpert - one more instrumental song
 Commercial: Tareyton 100 cigarettes
 Closing credits and ABC network ID
 Show announcer: Dick Tufeld
Production Code: 34-HP-67
Total running time: 58:27
